trans-unit.source: Install MongoDB on a virtual machine running Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Install MongoDB on a virtual machine running Windows Server

trans-unit.source: [MongoDB][MongoDB] is a popular open-source, high-performance NoSQL database.
trans-unit.target: [MongoDB][MongoDB] is a popular open-source, high-performance NoSQL database.

trans-unit.source: Using the [Azure portal][AzureManagementPortal], you can create a virtual machine running Windows Server from the Image Gallery, using the classic deployment model.
trans-unit.target: Using the [Azure portal][AzureManagementPortal], you can create a virtual machine running Windows Server from the Image Gallery, using the classic deployment model.

trans-unit.source: You can then install and configure a MongoDB database on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You can then install and configure a MongoDB database on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine running Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine running Windows Server

trans-unit.source: Follow these instructions to create a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Follow these instructions to create a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can add an endpoint for MongoDB while creating the virtual machine, and configure it as follows: name it as **Mongo**, use **TCP** as the protocol, and set both the public and private ports to **27017**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can add an endpoint for MongoDB while creating the virtual machine, and configure it as follows: name it as **Mongo**, use **TCP** as the protocol, and set both the public and private ports to **27017**.

trans-unit.source: To provide storage for the virtual machine, attach a data disk and then initialize it so that Windows can use it.
trans-unit.target: To provide storage for the virtual machine, attach a data disk and then initialize it so that Windows can use it.

trans-unit.source: You can either attach an existing disk if you already have data you want to use, or attach an empty disk.
trans-unit.target: You can either attach an existing disk if you already have data you want to use, or attach an empty disk.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on initializing the disk, see "How to: Initialize a new data disk in Windows Server" in [How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine](storage-windows-attach-disk.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on initializing the disk, see "How to: Initialize a new data disk in Windows Server" in [How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine](storage-windows-attach-disk.md).

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learned how to create a virtual machine running Windows Server, remotely connect to it, and attach a data disk.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learned how to create a virtual machine running Windows Server, remotely connect to it, and attach a data disk.

trans-unit.source: You also learned how to install and configure MongoDB on the Windows-based virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You also learned how to install and configure MongoDB on the Windows-based virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can now access MongoDB on the Windows-based virtual machine, by following the advanced topics in the [MongoDB documentation][MongoDocs].
